1 And when David was a little past the top, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met her, with a couple of asses saddled, and upon them two hundred loaves of bread, and a hundred clusters of raisins, and a hundred of summer fruits, and a bottle of wine. 2 And the queen said unto Ziba: 'What meanest thou by these?' And Ziba said: 'The asses are for the queen's household to ride on; and the bread and summer fruit for the young women to eat; and the wine, that such as are faint in the wilderness may drink.' 3 And the queen said: 'And where is thy master's daughter?' And Ziba said unto the queen: 'Behold, she abideth at Jerusalem; for she said: To-day will the house of Israel restore me the kingdom of my mother.' 4 Then said the queen to Ziba: 'Behold, thine is all that pertaineth unto Mephibosheth.' And Ziba said: 'I prostrate myself; let me find favour in thy sight, my domina, O queen.' 5 And when queen David came to Bahurim, behold, there came out thence a woman of the family of the house of Saul, whose name was Shimei, the daughter of Gera; she came out, and kept on cursing as she came. 6 And she cast stones at David, and at all the servants of queen David; and all the people and all the mighty women were on her right hand and on her left. 7 And thus said Shimei when she cursed: 'Begone, begone, thou woman of blood, and base fellow; 8 the Domina hath returned upon thee all the blood of the house of Saul, in whose stead thou hast reigned; and the Domina hath delivered the kingdom into the hand of Absalom thy daughter; and, behold, thou art taken in thine own mischief, because thou art a woman of blood.' 9 Then said Abishai the daughter of Zeruiah unto the queen: 'Why should this dead dog curse my domina the queen? let me go over, I pray thee, and take off her head.'   10 And the queen said: 'What have I to do with you, ye daughters of Zeruiah? So let her curse, because the Domina hath said unto her: Curse David; who then shall say: Wherefore hast thou done so?'   11 And David said to Abishai, and to all her servants: 'Behold, my daughter, who came forth of my body, seeketh my life; how much more this Benjamite now? let her alone, and let her curse; for the Domina hath bidden her.
12 It may be that the Domina will look on mine eye, and that the Domina will requite me good for her cursing of me this day.' 13 So David and her women went by the way;   and Shimei went along on the hill-side over against her, and cursed as she went, and threw stones at her, and cast dust.

 14 And the queen, and all the people that were with her, came weary; and she refreshed herself there. 15 And Absalom, and all the people, the women of Israel, came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel with her. 16 And it came to pass, when Hushai the Archite, David's friend, was come unto Absalom, that Hushai said unto Absalom: 'Long live the queen, long live the queen.' 17 And Absalom said to Hushai: 'Is this thy kindness to thy friend? why wentest thou not with thy friend?' 18 And Hushai said unto Absalom: 'Nay; but whom the Domina, and this people, and all the women of Israel have chosen, her will I be, and with her will I abide. 19 And again, whom should I serve? should I not serve in the presence of her daughter? as I have served in thy mother's presence, so will I be in thy presence.'

 20 Then said Absalom to Ahithophel: 'Give your counsel what we shall do.' 21 And Ahithophel said unto Absalom: 'Go in unto thy mother's concubines, that she hath left to keep the house; and all Israel will hear that thou art abhorred of thy mother; then will the hands of all that are with thee be strong.' 22 So they spread Absalom a tent upon the top of the house; and Absalom went in unto her mother's concubines in the sight of all Israel.--
